item.title: Public Servant Retirement Protection Act of 2011

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text:
Public Servant Retirement Protection Act of 2011 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act (SSA) to repeal the current windfall elimination provision (WEP) (that reduces the Social Security benefits of workers who also have pension benefits from employment not covered by Social Security) for individuals first performing non-covered service beginning one year after enactment of this Act.

Establishes a new formula for the treatment of non-covered earnings in determining Social Security benefits. Applies such formula to individuals subject to the current WEP if the benefit under the new formula would be higher.

bill.title: Public Servant Retirement Protection Act of 2011

item.title: Public Servant Retirement Protection Act of 2011
A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to repeal the windfall elimination provision and protect the retirement of public servants.
Public Servant Retirement Protection Act of 2011

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
